@Nerice wrote:

Well, I got some stuff to work decently ok, and failed awesomely on other parts (so awesomely I screwed up what did work trying to fix it grrr). Might play with it more later.

At least I learned some stuff in the process.

PS - pd, your gm.thz file downloads as a 0 byte nothing

Is the source available for thier analysis plugins?

Will look at your stuff pd now that you fixed the link or whatever.[/quote]

As much as any Java app's source is
Granted, I haven't delved far beyond the license checking, so it might take a while to understand the structure (it's a massive program if you've never used it).

item.title: Would "cleaner" code help you guys out?
item.dc:creator: @Nerice Nerice
item.description:
@Nerice wrote:

Iwill work on something tonight. my idea > code is usually messy code at the start though lol.

Step 1. Determine if a value passed in is a constant value.
Step 2. Is the check(s) against it always false.
Step 3. Change/Remove it, update everything.

There is 307 methods where at least one paremeter is a constant in the cleint files this time around... Not all lead to dead code but... it would still make readability easier in those cases.

Method 19... 8? paremeters becomes 2.

http://moparisthebest.zeeblo.com/index.php?pv=getpaste&id=61

Easier said than done, but I got some ideas to play around with to work on implementing it.

Read full topic
item.source: Would "cleaner" code help you guys out?

item.title: Would "cleaner" code help you guys out?

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I think this is the exact thing krichevskoy was talking about in the thread entitled "deob quality", he said he may write more transforms for saev's deobber to remove bits of dead code and such like this, but then of course like all of us he got sidetracked by rs3

have you got a plan for removing dead code?

Read full topic
item.source: Would "cleaner" code help you guys out?

item.title: Would "cleaner" code help you guys out?
item.dc:creator: @Nerice Nerice
item.description:
@Nerice wrote:

Like...

method(int i) {
.....

if(someint == i + 75) {
...
}
}

The method parameter is always the same.. say 0, so the if is really
if(someint == 75) ...

So, changing the if's and removing the method signature for the int and updating all the method calls not to pass it in etc...

Also in places where it checks a bool that is passed in that is always the same, so it can never get to the code below it, removing the code part that will never be reached.

if(bool == false){
.....
}

bool is always true, usually passed in as a paremeter and this is the only place its used in the method. Could remove just the code, or remove the bool check and the method paremeter..

Removing the freaking stupid do/while loops that will never loop (just removng the do/while surrounding the code). Removing the empty forever loops that will never be reached due to a check from a method paremeter (usually, maybe always?) that will never be able to be true.

Not saying to neccesarily use it, but to help readability a bit while studing it. No reason to be looking at code that will never ever be ran...

Read full topic
item.source: Would "cleaner" code help you guys out?
